Text.Text: *You* - you deceived me.  There were no other troops within Kuldahar Valley.  Your tricks will not spare you from death this time, *dog.*  Once you're dead, I will raise your corpses and have you march on Iselore... then burn his precious oak to the ground.

*You* again?!  I thought my troops in the Pass would have dispatched you by now - bah, it is no matter!  If Iselore dares not face me, I will send your heads to him on pikes then burn his precious oak to the ground!
Nothing but his death - I only sought to lure him away from the Heartstone Gem.  Away from it, he could be dealt with - and Kuldahar would finally belong to the Legion of the Chimera.

Bold words - and you shall pay for them in blood.  After you are dead, I will raise your corpse to serve in the Legion of the Chimera.  I will have you march on Iselore himself, and have him die at *your* hands.
Bane's will *is* the will of the Legion - If you wish a demonstration of the Black Lord's power, then I will *give* it to you.  DIE!
Pah, the gnome has nowhere to run - just as *you* have nowhere to run.  Beg if you will, but in the end, you will die - just as Kuldahar will die.

I am Hiepherus, Hand of Bane.  This valley belongs to the Legion of the Chimera.  All lives within it are ours to do with as we please.  Those fools in the watchtower, they are dead already - and that druid, Iselore - *all* will serve the Chimera in death.
You *question* my devotion?!  It is Bane's *will* I lend his powers to the Chimera!  With Bane by their side, the Legion will grow str-
You wish to see my Lord's favor?!  Then watch - and DIE!

Time and death favor us, *dog.*  We have killed many of them already, and only a handful remain, hiding behind walls like frightened children.  I have already turned their slain and the bodies of their ancestors against them - they *will* fall.

Kuldahar will burn, and all its works will be cast down at the feet of the Chimera.  As for the half-breed druid, he cannot ignore me forever - I will draw him away from his precious Heartstone Gem, then tear *his* heart from his chest.
The coward *hides* behind the power of the Heartstone Gem - but he will not hide forever.  My forces will pillage this Valley until he has no choice but to come and face us.

When you feel the Black Hand of Bane *crushing* your heart, you will regret those words.  When I raise your corpses, I will see to it you serve a special place in the ranks of the Legion - and Bane will be pleased, as well.
Bold words, but my plans for you are worse than death.  When I raise your corpses, I will see to it you serve a special place in the ranks of the Legion - and Bane will be pleased, as well.
I know full well where you stand - but you are far from the shredded banner of Targos.  *Now* you stand before Hiepherus, Hand of Bane.

This valley belongs to the Legion of the Chimera.  All lives within it are ours to do with as we please.  Those fools in the watchtower, they are dead already - and that druid, Iselore - *all* will serve the Chimera in death.
Pah, the gnome has nowhere to run.  As for you - how is it that you stand against me, brother?  Surely you know of the Legion of the Chimera, and you know that all such as we have a place there.
You wield deceit like a club, my black-hearted kin, not as the dagger it is - it seems the Ten-Towns have poisoned you with their weakness.  I see there will be no persuading you.

Ah, I was hoping I might make you see as the other members of the Legion have not.  Join our campaign of extermination against the Northerners - together, we will take back what is ours, and leave the lesser races to burn.

Kuldahar Valley is the first stone in the foundation of terror the Legion is building - we have slain many of the filthy nature-worshippers of Kuldahar, and raised even more of their dead from their graves to join our Legion.

It was as if the land itself favors the Legion... within the graveyard to the north, there were many powerful corpses waiting to be resurrected... they have become the spine of my undead forces here in the Pass, and they kill methodically and well.
Slain in some disaster years ago, I believe - an avalanche, or landslide - it is no matter.  Now their strength serves the Legion... and Bane.

For the moment, we remain here... which suits my purposes.  We have been tasked with drawing the accursed archdruid, Iselore, away from the shelter of the Heartstone Gem - once he leaves its protective circle, he will become vulnerable.  I will tear the heart from his chest, and as a token of my service, offer it up to the Legion - and my lord Bane, of course.

Eh... hmm, yes, I have other plans in motion as well.  I seek something within the Pass... something my Lord Bane has tasked me with.  It is no concern of yours.  All that matters is slaying Iselore and seizing Kuldahar.

Ah, my offer of an alliance is a solid one, but do *you* speak true, my black-hearted kin?  Your words speak of reason, but I hear the lies trailing behind them.  No... there will be no talk of a settlement, and I will *not* withdraw my forces.
*Leave Kuldahar?*  Your boldness surprises me!  What you ask is impossible - Kuldahar belongs to the Legion now.  Are these your *only* terms?
It will not be touched by nature for long... the Legion has already sunk its fangs into this cursed valley, and soon all life in this valley shall be fed to the hunger of the Chimera.

Pah, the gnome has nowhere to run.  As for you - how is it that you stand against me, sister?  Surely you know of the Legion of the Chimera, and you know that all such as we have a place there.  I can feel the power streaming from you - with you by my side, we would have no need of an army of dead; the soldiers we breed would be terror enough.
You will regret those words, woman - I will see to it even in death you will know no peace.  I will raise you to dance in my armies until your corpse collapses to *dust.*

Kuldahar Valley is the first stone in the foundation of terror the Legion is building - we have slain many of the filthy nature-worshippers of Kuldahar, and raised even more of their dead from their graves to join our Legion.  I intended to spare you this - it was my wish you birth our soldiers, not fight them.  But your death will still serve the Legion.

Pah, the gnome has nowhere to run.  As for you - has the Underdark finally come to offer an alliance?  Surely you know of the strength of the Legion of the Chimera.  I can feel the power streaming from you - with you by my side, we would have no need of an army of dead; the soldiers we breed would be terror enough.

Pah, the gnome has nowhere to run.  As for you - has the Underdark finally come to offer an alliance?  Surely you know of the strength of the Legion of the Chimera.  You would be mighty in our armies, and with you, the North would soon fall.
Perhaps you do not know who it is you are dealing with - nor the forces at my command.  I am Hiepherus, Hand of Bane.

This valley belongs to the Legion of the Chimera.  All lives within it are ours to do with as we please.  Those fools in the watchtower, they are dead already - and that druid, Iselore - *all* will serve the Chimera in death.
Eh?  What do you m-?!  By Bane's hand, you *lie!*  There is no other way into the Valley that the Legion does not control!
Pah!  We shall see!  This is not the ending of matters between us, *dog,* I promise you that!
Pah!  I have wasted *enough* time on you... alive or dead, I will see to it you *join* the Legion.  Soon your corpses will march on Kuldahar, and you will butcher Iselore where he stands!
I would be more afraid of our Lord Bane's judgment, Hiepherus.  I feel he is displeased with you... and your lack of concern for his wishes.
Since you feared to face us the first time, I decided to give you an excuse to flee.  I did not think a child's trick would work so well.
What do you want with Iselore?
Surrender, Hiepherus.  I will not ask twice.
I tire of you and your empty threats.  We shall see who stands at the end of this battle.
We stand in *no one's* stead.
I would be more afraid of our Lord Bane's judgment, Hiepherus.  I feel he is displeased with you... and your lack of concern for his wishes.
Since you feared to face us the first time, I was forced to seek you out.
What do you want with Iselore?
Surrender, Hiepherus.  I will not ask twice.
I tire of you and your empty threats, Banite.  We shall see who stands at the end of this battle.
We stand in *no one's* stead.
I would be more afraid of our Lord Bane's judgment, Hiepherus.  I feel he is displeased with you... and your lack of concern for his wishes.
So you are no match for him as long as he stands in Kuldahar?  I doubt Iselore would *need* the Heartstone Gem to deal with you.
Don't you mean Lord Bane, Hiepherus?  Or have you forgotten the face of your master?
So you are no match for him as long as he stands in Kuldahar?  I doubt Iselore would *need* the Heartstone Gem to deal with you.
Surrender, Hiepherus.  I will not ask twice.
I tire of you and your empty threats, Banite.  We shall see who stands at the end of this battle.
We stand in *no one's* stead.
Surrender, Hiepherus.  I will not ask twice.
I tire of you and your empty threats, Banite.  We shall see who stands at the end of this battle.
We stand in *no one's* stead.
I would be more afraid of our Lord Bane's judgment, Hiepherus.  I feel he is displeased with you... and your lack of concern for his wishes.
What do you want with Iselore?
All of this for the Legion of the Chimera?  And what of your Lord Bane?
Enough of this - prepare to die!
Your symbol marks you as one of the faith - but I was not aware that Bane himself had blessed the Legion.  Who are you?
Who are you?  What are you doing here?
The Legion has threatened us countless times, yet here we stand.
Your threats hold no weight with me, orog.  Leave Kuldahar, or you will be slain.
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
If you serve the Legion of the Chimera, then prepare to die.
So a priest of Bane has bent his knee to the Legion?  You have fallen far, Banite - but you will do no more evil here.
Serve the Chimera?  For a priest of Bane, you seem more concerned with the Legion's wishes than those of your "Lord."
The dead worship no one, Banite - have you lost your way?  Perhaps the Legion's wishes differ than those of your Lord.
I was not aware a priest of the Black Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite.
I was not aware our Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy.
So the Legion doesn't hold Kuldahar yet?  Your conquest is far from complete - unless you wage war only with words.
Iselore and the people of Kuldahar live, then.
Your threats hold no weight with me, Banite.  Leave Kuldahar, or you will be slain.
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
We will never serve you - your evil stops here.
If you serve the Legion of the Chimera, then prepare to die.
Spare me whatever lies you have been fed.  Your foul religion will plague Kuldahar and its people no more.
Bane is no *true* ally of anyone - he is a lord of strife and hatred.  If you see an alliance with the Chimera, then you are blind to your Lord's wishes.
Bane is no *true* ally of anyone - he is a lord of strife and hatred.  If you see an alliance with the Chimera, then you are blind to your Lord's wishes.
Can you be such a fool?  Bane does not "lend" anything to anyone.  No Banite would ever say such things - unless he has fallen already.
How is it you are such a fool?  Bane does not "lend" anything to anyone.  No true Banite would ever say such things - unless he has *fallen* already.
Iselore "ignores" you?  You must pose a grave threat to him, indeed.
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
That day will never come - your evil stops here.
If you serve the Legion of the Chimera, then prepare to die.
It seems the only one resorting to a coward's tactics is you.  Is the Legion truly so desperate?
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
That day will never come - your evil stops here.
If you serve the Legion of the Chimera, then prepare to die.
So a priest of Bane has bent his knee to the Legion?  You have fallen far, Banite - but you will do no more evil here.
Serve the Chimera?  For a priest of Bane, you seem more concerned with the Legion's wishes than those of your "Lord."
The dead worship no one, Banite - have you lost your way?  Perhaps the Legion's wishes differ than those of your Lord.
I was not aware a priest of the Black Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite.
I was not aware our Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite.
So the Legion doesn't hold Kuldahar yet?  Your conquest is far from complete - unless you wage war only with words.
Iselore and the people of Kuldahar live, then.
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
We will never serve you - your evil stops here.
If you serve the Legion of the Chimera, then prepare to die.
Your symbol marks you as one of the faith - but I was not aware that Bane himself had blessed the Legion.  Who are you?
We are not brothers; the blood of the lower planes runs in my veins.  I know where I stand, and it is not under your banner.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
Then perhaps a settlement can be reached - after the Legion removes itself from Kuldahar.
Then perhaps a settlement can be reached - after the Legion removes itself from Kuldahar.
I am not here to negotiate with you, "brother."  I am here to demand you leave Kuldahar, or you will be slain.
I already have a place, and it is not beneath your banner.
I stand with the Ten-Towns - and their wealth.
And what is the Chimera's place in the North?
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
Only the weak and desperate cast their lot in with the Chimera, dog.
My heritage has enough of such pacts running in my blood.  If you stand with the Legion, then you are our enemy.
We may share the same blood, but our hearts are different.  If you stand with the Legion, then you are our enemy.
Who are you, then, to claim Kuldahar as yours?
I already have a place, and it is not beneath your banner.
I stand with the Ten-Towns - and their wealth.
And what is the Chimera's place in the North?
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
Only the weak and desperate cast their lot in with the Chimera, dog.
We may share the same blood, but our hearts are different.  If you stand with the Legion, then you are our enemy.
And what of your campaign in Kuldahar and the North?  I sign on with those with vision, not just words.
Where did these corpses come from?
Where do you intend to move these forces?
Remaining here suits your purposes?  What do you mean?
So a priest of Bane has bent his knee to the Legion?  You have fallen far, Banite - but you will do no more evil here.
For a priest of Bane, you seem more concerned with the Legion's wishes than those of your Lord.
I doubt the Legion and your Lord share the same vision, Banite - have you lost your way?
I was not aware a priest of the Black Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite... and weakness.
I was not aware our Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite... and weakness.
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
Then that is all I wished to know.  There will be no more negotiation - except you will leave Kuldahar at once, and you will put the dead you have raised to rest.
I think Iselore will be safe in our hands, Banite.  Our negotiations are finished - and so are the Legion's plans for Kuldahar.
So a priest of Bane has bent his knee to the Legion?  You have fallen far, Banite - but you will do no more evil here.
For a priest of Bane, you seem more concerned with the Legion's wishes than those of your Lord.
"Our only concern is serving the Legion?"  I doubt the Legion and your Lord share the same vision, Banite - have you lost your way?
I was not aware a priest of the Black Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite... and weakness.
You seem more concerned with the Legion's wishes than those of our Lord.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite... and weakness.
Why do you value Kuldahar?  Surely you would not wish to stay in this place so... touched... by nature.
Your symbol marks you as one of the faith - but I was not aware that Bane himself had blessed the Legion.  Who are you?
The thought of breeding with you fills me with enough terror as it is.
One of my ancestors bred with a demon once, priest.  I have no desire to repeat the experience - especially with one such as you.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
Then perhaps a settlement can be reached - after the Legion removes itself from Kuldahar.
Then perhaps a settlement can be reached - after the Legion removes itself from Kuldahar.
I am not here to negotiate with you, "brother."  I am here to demand you leave Kuldahar, or you will be slain.
We are not kin; the blood of the lower planes runs in my veins.  I know where I stand, and it is not under your banner.
I stand with the Ten-Towns - and their wealth.
And what is the Chimera's place in the North?
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
I know that only the weak and desperate cast their lot in with the Chimera, dog.
My heritage has enough of such pacts running in my blood.  If you stand with the Legion, then you are our enemy.
We may share the same blood, but our hearts are different.  If you stand with the Legion, then you are our enemy.
Do you offer nothing but threats?  What of your grand vision for Kuldahar and the North?
I am not here to trade words with you, "brother."  I am here to demand you leave Kuldahar, or you will be slain.
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
I know that only the weak and desperate cast their lot in with the Chimera, dog.
We may share the same blood, priest, but our hearts are different.  If you stand with the Legion, then you are our enemy.
The thought of breeding with you fills me with enough terror as it is.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
Then perhaps a settlement can be reached - after the Legion removes itself from Kuldahar.
Then perhaps a settlement can be reached - after the Legion removes itself from Kuldahar.
I am not here to negotiate with you, orog.  I am here to demand you leave Kuldahar, or you will be slain.
I stand with the Ten-Towns - and their wealth.
And what is the Chimera's place in the North?
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
Only the weak and desperate cast their lot in with the Chimera, dog.
If you stand with the Legion, then you are our enemy.  Prepare to die.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
A... tempting offer.  If you were to tell me your plans, perhaps I could be persuaded.
Then perhaps a settlement can be reached - after the Legion removes itself from Kuldahar.

So a priest of Bane has bent his knee to the Legion?  You have fallen far, Banite - but you will do no more evil here.
Serve the Chimera?  For a priest of Bane, you seem more concerned with the Legion's wishes than those of your "Lord."
The dead worship no one, Banite - have you lost your way?  Perhaps the Legion's wishes differ than those of your Lord.
I was not aware a priest of the Black Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy, Banite.
I was not aware our Lord *served* anyone.  Your words reek of blasphemy.
So the Legion doesn't hold Kuldahar yet?  Your conquest is far from complete - unless you wage war only with words.
Iselore and the people of Kuldahar live, then.
I had not thought you would have fallen for such an obvious trick, nor come to greet us alone.  Did you think we were the only reinforcements entering the Valley?
We will never serve you - your evil stops here.
If you serve the Legion of the Chimera, then prepare to die.
Is there?  You see one airship before you - how many airships do you think we have, Banite?
